data.title: A Great Stay
data.text: I was in DC for a business trip and we stayed at the Courtyard Washington Embassy Row and I must say that it was exceptional. Every member of the staff was incredibly helpful, friendly, upbeat, and considerate. The room was comfortable and I enjoyed how centrally located the hotel was.

data.title: Perfect location
data.text: Staff were second to none at this hotel! We only stayed for one night and they helped wherever possible. We arrived from the train station early and the kind receptionist did everything possible to check us in early and kept our bags. We then only had to return after 3 when our room was ready. It is a perfect location if you are wanting to walk to the White House and all the tourist activities near by. The only downside is it is slightly dated but at the same time great value for money and would definitely stay here again.

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear kcromb91, 

We're delighted to hear that our front desk teams assisted you with a warm professional attitude. Our location to many tourist destinations is wonderful and were glad to hear that it worked out perfectly during your stay. We hope to see you again soon.

Warm regards,

Luis A.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good Hotel but noisey
data.text:
Stayed here for seven days room 311 third floor at front of hotel. 
Wonderful reception staff, especially Hylina who remembered our names all the week and was very helpful. 
After an evening flight from the UK and getting to the hotel approx 10pm was looking forward to a good night's sleep. 
12am woken by deep throated Audi sitting down stairs with engine running for about 20 mins in driveway. 
Then woken at 6.00am by traffic noise and did mention it to Hylina who did say we could change rooms but wife didn't want upheaval. 
Sound proofing needs to be upgraded especially floors due to selfish people in room above stomping around at 5.30am. 
The Nage restaurant was excellent and supplied a good breakfast. 
Hotel in convenient position to get everywhere easily. 
We had a lovely stay apart from the few noisey nights

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Roger W,

Thank you for taking the time to review our Hotel based on your recent stay. Please accept my sincere apologies for the traffic noise that interrupted your sleep. I would like to discuss this further with you. If you could please give me a call at the Hotel at your earliest convenience.

Sincerely,

Luis A.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Missed the mark
data.text:
I have stayed at this property many times but a recent stay disappointed me -- I hope it is not the beginning of a trend. The hotel is solid. Modern Courtyard appointments, pretty clean.  Nice front desk staff.  No Bistro in this one, however,  There is a place to dine in the building (Nage) which is pretty good and has a small bar.  The location is fine. A bit of a walk to the Metro, but not too far.

It has a fitness facility but it is SMALL. Very little if you want to lift weight- just dumbbells and a bench, nothing more.

My issue with this stay was with the HVAC.  It was a very chilly Fall evening with temperatures down into the 30s and, well, I didn't have any heat. None. It was cold.  I didn't get more than a couple of hours of sleep due to my only finding this out in the middle of the night when the temp in the room had dipped into the low 60s.   The staff apologized and the issue was fixed the next day however, nobody offered to do anything other than fix the heat.  I'm a road-warrior and go with the flow but when you pay for a place to sleep and you don't sleep, well, call me crazy, but maybe the hotel should do something for you.  Again, I go with the flow and let it go.  Now the thing that really turned me off... after I checked out, I let the hotel management know about my experience via an e mail. More of a constructive, sharing my experience, e mail, nothing in there that indicated I was mad, just a, "hey, you should know about this" kind of note.   No response.  Nothing. That was very disappointing.  I'm going to have to think twice before booking here again just because of  that.  

In sum, I've usually had good experiences here, just not this time.

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Assistant General Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Pa Traveler176,

Thank you for choosing Courtyard by Marriot Embassy Row for your DC travel needs. I am very sorry about the HVAC issue and the failure for us to follow up. I can assure you that this is an extreme abnormality. I would like a chance to speak with you to explain why this happened and to more formally apologize. We hope you will afford us another opportunity to serve you in the future, and I thank you for staying with us.

Sincerely,
Shannon J
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great location!
data.text: This hotel was located close to clothing stores (Gap, H&M, etc), restaurants and all tourist sites. I went on a run and ran by the White House and Lincoln Memorial! It was only a short cab ride to nearby trendy neighborhoods. Would recommend!

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Assistant General Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Jennifer K,

We are so glad you were satisfied and happy with your stay at the Courtyard by Marriott Embassy Row. Our great location to everything is a definite plus. We are overjoyed that we were able to meet and exceed your expectations. We hope to see you in the near future.

Sincerely,
Shannon J
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hotel, location - slightly confusing name
data.text: Really nice hotel in a great location, approximately a half-dozen blocks directly north of the White House, with an easy walk to the nighlife of Dupont Circle, K Street and access to most of the historical attractions within comfortable walking distance. The staff were friendly and ever-willing to change cash, call a cab, store bags, let you chill and charge your phone even after check-out. The room's and other facilities are comfortable and spacious enough without being special. One slightly confusing note is the name - it's quite a long way from what most cab drivers etc would consider to by Embassy Row ..

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Assistant General Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Steve D,

Thank you for choosing Courtyard by Marriot Embassy Row; we are thrilled you enjoyed your stay with us, and we hope you will choose us again when making travel plans for the future.

Sincerely,
Shannon J
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Perfect for family visit to Washington, DC
data.text:
Great hotel, supremely friendly and kind staff, super location!  Stayed here for 3 nights with kids and it was ideal.  Location made it easy to walk to all  the sights of D.C. or metro was easily accessible.  Had a good-sized room with 2 queen beds on the 8th floor - so could hear some D.C. traffic but not much.  For the kids, the pool was wonderful because it is located in the basement so we didn't have to shush everyone too often.  Whirlpool also.  Valet parking was easy. 
Ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant one day - food was great, fast service and pricing was fair.  
Overall, it could not have been a better choice for a trip to D.C.

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Assistant General Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear IvyE706,

I would like to start by first thanking you for staying with us at the Courtyard by Marriott Embassy Row. It is fantastic to hear that you were pleased with our staff, location, and amenities. We look forward to seeing you the next time you are visiting Washington DC.

Sincerely,
Shannon J
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: PERFECT STAY
data.text: Me and my family have a great time for 3 weeks stay in the hotel they have a very nice staff and friendly even the office manager is great ms.agnes! Thank you for all the wonderfull experiences.i Highly recommended this hotel.!

data.title: Fantastic trip!
data.text:
Close to every major attraction. Walking distance to many of them
Excellent restaurant and close to many other restaurants as well
Good service, fast and effective.  Smiles all over
Very quiet and clean.

data.title: Dedication Ceremony /WhiteHouse
data.text:
From the moment I arrived I was greeted with warmth and professionalism! I didnt want to leave. The accomodations were excellent and the staff was the best!!
It was a great location for walking to and from the mall, shops and restaurants. 
I enjoyed the  the shrimp & grits for breakfast! Many thanks to Francessa who made my stay the best with her knowledge of places to eat and excellent directions.
I look forward to going back real soon!

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Assistant General Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:

Thank you for choosing to stay with us for your DC travels; we realize you have many choices in the area, and we appreciate you choosing the Courtyard. We are overjoyed that we were able to meet and exceed your service expectations, and we hope to see you soon.

Sincerely,
Shannon J.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: fantastic location but poor soundproofing meant a bad nights sleep
data.text: I stay in this area often and decided to give this hotel a try since the price was reasonable compared to other hotels.  The location is topnotch, parking is reasonable compared to other hotels in the area and the lobby and rooms are clean and updated with free water bottles and free wifi.  The beds are comfortable and overall this is a great hotel....unless you are a light sleeper. We stayed on the fourth floor and were greatly disappointed with the street noise that kept us up with sirens and horns, all hours of the night. Better soundproofing should have been used to block out the street noise in this busy city as I have stayed in multiple hotels in the immediate area and slept much better due to better insulation of the walls and windows.  Unless you are a heavy sleeper or use earplugs, this is not a good nights sleep.

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Assistant General Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Luv2Travel,

Thank you for choosing Courtyard by Marriot Embassy Row for your recent stay in DC. I am glad that you enjoyed our rooms and amenities. I am very sorry to hear that you were disturbed by street noise. We hope you will afford us another opportunity to serve you in the future, and I thank you for staying with us.

Sincerely,
Shannon J.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lovely hotel
data.text:
Lovely hotel. Comfortable beds nice big size rooms. The pool and spa were a nice amenity. 
Reception Staff were very friendly and helpful.
Location was good walking distance of all the main attractions

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Assistant General Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review

data.title: Great Accommodations and Staff
data.text: We stayed for 10 days at the Courtyard Marriott on Embassy Row and the location was amazing. We walked almost everywhere. The staff became like family, especially Hylina.  She always greeted us with warm hellos, and always asked about our day. She gave us great advice on restaurants to try; was extremely helpful with anything we needed, and made sure we enjoyed our stay. The room was clean, spacious and the restaurant staff was accommodating to special food requests.

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Guest Relations Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Murray,

Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. We truly enjoyed having you with us! I am glad that Hylina and everyone felt like family to you. Please come back and visit us the next time you are in Washington DC.

Sincerely,
Shannon J
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Location, location, location...
data.text: The staff at the Marriott Courtyard Embassy Row were incredible. We were there for 5 days for our daughter's wedding and Francesca and Helena made us feel like family. Housekeeping kept our room cleaned and toweled. The family that ran the Nave restaurant in the hotel made us feel like family also. The wedding was beautiful and our stay delightful. Any return trip to DC will use the Marriott Courtyard Embassy Row for our accommodations.

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Guest Relations Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear John B.,
Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us and for choosing us to accommodate you during your daughters wedding! We enjoyed having you and your family with us. I have shared your comments with our team and we hope to see you the next time you visit Washington DC.
Sincerely,
Shannon J
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Closer than you think........
data.text:
Let me give my standard disclosure about my ratings.  I rarely give 5 stars unless I'm at a full-service resort property.  That said, this is my second time staying at this location and service makes the difference.  The front desk staff exceeds service expectations. In fact, they remembered us from a visit several months ago.  That's welcoming!  Housekeeping didn't miss the mark, at all.  The bathroom was clean, clean, clean.  I didn't see loose hairs or dirt that I've seen at JW properties.  

This location is about a 15-20 minute walk from the Whitehouse, 5-10 minute walk from two Metro stations, Starbucks less than 10 minutes, and many restaurants and eateries close by if you don't eat at the in-house restaurant.

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear  Sandpower_S,

Thank you so much for your valuable feedback. It's rewarding reviews like these that help motivate our team into providing memorable customer experiences. We are extremely glad that our team provided exemplary customer service on both your stays. We hope to see you again and feel free to reach out me on your next trip.

Warm regards,

Luis A.
GSS Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good stay for business
data.text:
Very convenient if you have meetings or an event at the think-tank next door as I did. It is about an 8-10 min walk to the nearest metro station - Dupont Circle - though if you are dragging along luggage, then add a few more minutes. 

The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room I had was very spacious (and therefore, uncharacteristic of many central DC hotels) though it was a little dated. Free use of computers and printers in the lobby level was nice.

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Elina N,

Thank you for taking the time to review our Hotel based on your recent stay. We're glad to hear that our central location and spacious rooms worked out perfectly during your stay. We hope to see you again. 

Warm Regards,

Luis A.
GSS Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great service, great location, noisy plumbing
data.text: Staff at this hotel were very helpful. They were kind enough to move us up in line in front of a large group that were checking in and had problems with their reservation. Rooms are spacious. Hotel is close to DuPont circle and a tour bus stop. The attached restaurant has a good selection of breakfast items and service there was excellent as well. Only drawback is that you can hear the toilets in neighboring rooms flushing very loudly. Kind of odd, since there weren't problems with any other kind of noise.

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear williedillo,

Thank you for taking the time to review our Hotel. We're glad that our team members were able to provide prompt and friendly service upon check-in. We hope to see you again.

Warm regards,

Luis A.
GSS Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good location, very comfortable room and friendly staff
data.text:
This is a good pick if you are staying in Washington DC.
The beds were super comfortable and room was big.
There wasn't a mini fridge when we checked in but we were able to request for one that got delivered promptly.
There is also a indoor pool and spa, good for relaxing after a long day out.
There is a bar on the ground level which offers happy hour drinks and snacks from 4pm to 7pm - no need to go far if you are just after a drink.
The staff were always friendly and prompt.

owner_response.author: GstServiceManager, Manager at Courtyard Washington Embassy Row, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Celia C,

Thank you for taking the time to review our Hotel. It's great to hear that you were able to take advantage of our pool/gym area along with our on-site restaurant Nage. We hope to see you again.

Thank you,

Luis A.
GSS Manager
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazing Hotel
data.text: The location and room were perfect for our  trip to DC. From the time we checked in to the check out, the staff was awesome. We stayed here for 3 nights.The Courtyard Marriott Embassy Row is located in a  safe neighbourhood between DuPont Circle and Logan Circle, in DC. Metro stops are about 10 minutes away on foot, and the White House is less than 15 minutes on foot directly south of the hotel.

Luis A.

data.title: Friendly hotel ... Location
data.text: Stayed here for 4 nights after arriving in Washington... On arrival the check in was fast the staff on the desk were very helpful at anytime...The room was a good size and very clean.... The location was ideal for walking to the White House and other Washington attractions, Also within walking distance of many restaurants and cafes.. I would definitely recommend this hotel...A special mentioned to Alysha at reception who was very helpful when we were trying to print off our boarding cards when leaving...
